result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Edward Romano Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony Edward Romano Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony Edward Romano Jr was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of the sentence. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges.

Consecutive to: to any other sentence. First month is to be served straight time, the remainder can be served at the Day Reporting Center. During that last 2 months the Court will allow for electronic monitoring if deemed appropriate.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Edward Romano Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript of PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING (26 pages) commencing JULY 30, 2015 received and filed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 8 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence. First month is to be served straight time, the remainder can be served at the Day Reporting Center. During that last 2 months the Court will allow for electronic monitoring if deemed appropriate.  Court stayed commencement until 08/10/2015 by 5:00pm.


Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of the sentence.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges.


Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Anthony Edward Romano in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 2 dismissed.
As to Count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Anthony Edward Romano in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Anthony Edward Romano in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Zachary Wittchow for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Per ADA Wittchow and Defense Counsel Smith, this case will remain in Branch 22 for resolution.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/26/15.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony Edward Romano in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Anthony Edward Romano in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
